column1: The US Centers for Disease Control has increased the alert level for Italy from 1 to 2 (exercise enhanced precautions). The US State Dept. Has revised the Level 2 advisory it already had in effect for reasons related to terrorism threats to incorporate COVID-19 threat. Both notices describe suggested actions to take when traveling in Italy.

Sorry I thought the CDC change was new, but it's only the State Dept advisory that is changed today. I don't normally follow the CDC, only State, and assumed State took action when the CDC did, but in this case there was a delay.
